questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : SOFTWARE TESTING (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)" ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN. (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: The following table lists some concepts from Software Testing.
questions.question_text_2:
The following table lists some concepts from Software Testing. 
  Match each term given in Column A with the related term given in Column B.
question_texts: The following table lists some concepts from Software Testing.

The following table lists some concepts from Software Testing. 
  Match each term given in Column A with the related term given in Column B.

options.option_text: i - a, ii - b, iii - c, iv - d
i - d, ii - c, iii - b, iv - a
i - b, ii - c, iii - a, iv - d
i - d, ii - b, iii - c, iv - a

questions.question_text_1: A mobile app sends a request over the network to the server, to retrieve results of students in a particular subject, upon receiving the request, the server responds back with the results data for that subject. In this scenario, which type of interface exists between the mobile app and the server?
question_texts: A mobile app sends a request over the network to the server, to retrieve results of students in a particular subject, upon receiving the request, the server responds back with the results data for that subject. In this scenario, which type of interface exists between the mobile app and the server?

questions.question_text_1:
In an organization, software developers and testers are cooperating with each other in order to reduce risks in using the software product. 
Considering this scenario, identify the minimum process maturity level of this organization.
question_texts:
In an organization, software developers and testers are cooperating with each other in order to reduce risks in using the software product. 
Considering this scenario, identify the minimum process maturity level of this organization.

questions.question_text_1: A software testing engineer performed various tests on a web application to ensure that users can easily access and use the application user interface on different types of devices such as smartphones, tablets, and desktop computers, all of which have different form factors and screen sizes. Which of the following types of testing does this scenario represent?
question_texts: A software testing engineer performed various tests on a web application to ensure that users can easily access and use the application user interface on different types of devices such as smartphones, tablets, and desktop computers, all of which have different form factors and screen sizes. Which of the following types of testing does this scenario represent?

_______________ deals with testing each linearly independent path in the CFG of the program.
question_texts:

questions.question_text_1:
Consider the following statements and choose the appropriate option. 
i) A module or a component is a self-contained element of a system. ii) Interfaces implement a mechanism for passing control and data between modules.
question_texts:
Consider the following statements and choose the appropriate option. 
i) A module or a component is a self-contained element of a system. ii) Interfaces implement a mechanism for passing control and data between modules.

options.option_text: Statement i) is correct and Statement ii) is incorrect.
Statement ii) is correct and Statement i) is incorrect.

questions.question_text_1:
Consider the following statements and choose the appropriate option. 
i) Each du-path is a simple path, so prime path coverage subsumes all-du-paths coverage. ii) All-du-paths coverage does not subsume edge coverage.
question_texts:
Consider the following statements and choose the appropriate option. 
i) Each du-path is a simple path, so prime path coverage subsumes all-du-paths coverage. ii) All-du-paths coverage does not subsume edge coverage.

options.option_text: Statement i) is correct and Statement ii) is incorrect.
Statement ii) is correct and Statement i) is incorrect.

questions.question_text_1:

A path from node ni to nj is a _________ if no node appears more than once, except possibly the first and last node.
question_texts:

A DD-path consists of a maximal chain of length __________.
question_texts:
Fill in the blank with the appropriate option.

questions.question_text_1:
Consider the following statements regarding the approaches in integration testing: 
i) In big bang approach, the entire system is tested as a whole. ii) Sandwich approach uses a mix of top-down and bottom-up testing approaches. iii) Top-down approach does not work well for systems with hierarchical design. 
Choose the correct option.
question_texts:
Consider the following statements regarding the approaches in integration testing: 
i) In big bang approach, the entire system is tested as a whole. ii) Sandwich approach uses a mix of top-down and bottom-up testing approaches. iii) Top-down approach does not work well for systems with hierarchical design. 
Choose the correct option.

options.option_text: Statement i) and iii) are correct. Statement ii) is incorrect.
Statement i) is correct. Statement ii) and iii) are incorrect.
Statement ii) and iii) are correct. Statement i) is incorrect.
Statement i) and ii) are correct. Statement iii) is incorrect.

questions.question_text_1: Complete path coverage on a CFG becomes infeasible due to which of the following reasons?
question_texts: Complete path coverage on a CFG becomes infeasible due to which of the following reasons?

options.option_text: Due to presence of multiple branches
Due to presence of multiple terminal nodes
Complete path coverage is always feasible
